intro: Neoalsomitra simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved neoalsomitra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
